skills.name: Round numbers to an appropriate degree to estimate the answer to a calculation

explanations.A: Almost, but is 39 closer to 30 or 40?
explanations.B: 151 to the nearest ten is 150, and 39 to the nearest ten is 40, so 150 - 40 will give a value very close to 151 - 39.
explanations.C: Not quite - we want to round each number to the nearest 10 to get the closest possible estimate. What is the nearest ten to 151, and the nearest ten to 39?
explanations.D: Almost, but is 151 closer to 150 or 160?

explanations.A: Not quite - we want to round each number to the nearest 10 to get the closest possible estimate. What is the nearest ten to 178, and the nearest ten to 21?
explanations.B: Almost, but is 178 closer to 170 or 180?
explanations.C: 178 to the nearest ten is 180, and 21 to the nearest ten is 20, so 180 - 20 will give a value very close to 178 - 21.
explanations.D: Almost, but is 21 closer to 20 or 30?

explanations.A: 483 to the nearest ten is 480, and 51 to the nearest ten is 50, so 480 ÷ 50 will give a value very close to 483 ÷ 51
explanations.B: Almost, but is 51 closer to 50 or 60?
explanations.C: Almost, but is 483 closer to 480 or 490?
explanations.D: Not quite - we want to round each number to the nearest 10 to get the closest possible estimate. What is the nearest ten to 483, and the nearest ten to 51?

explanations.A: Not quite - we want to round each number to the nearest 10 to get the closest possible estimate. What is the nearest ten to 372, and the nearest ten to 63?
explanations.B: Almost, but is 63 closer to 60 or 70?
explanations.C: Almost, but is 372 closer to 370 or 380?
explanations.D: 372 to the nearest ten is 370, and 63 to the nearest ten is 60, so 370 ÷ 60 will give a value very close to 372 ÷ 63

explanations.A: Not quite - we want to round each number to the nearest 10 to get the closest possible estimate. What is the nearest ten to 36, and the nearest ten to 77?
explanations.B: Almost, but is 36 closer to 30 or 40?
explanations.C: Almost, but is 77 closer to 70 or 80?
explanations.D: 36 to the nearest ten is 40, and 77 to the nearest ten is 80, so 40 x 80 will give a value very close to 36 x 77.

explanations.A: Almost, but is 57 closer to 50 or 60?
explanations.B: Not quite - we want to round each number to the nearest 10 to get the closest possible estimate. What is the nearest ten to 57, and the nearest ten to 96?
explanations.C: 57 to the nearest ten is 60, and 96 to the nearest ten is 100, so 60 x 100 will give a value very close to 57 x 96.
explanations.D: Almost, but is 96 closer to 90 or 100?

explanations.A: Almost, but is 429 closer to 420 or 430?
explanations.B: Not quite - we want to round each number to the nearest 10 to get the closest possible estimate. There are 31 days in July, so what is the nearest ten to 31, and the nearest ten to 429?
explanations.C: There are 31 days in July, which to the nearest ten is 30, and 429 to the nearest ten is 430, so 430 ÷ 30 will give a good estimate of the eggs per day.
explanations.D: Almost, but there are 31 days in July - is 31 closer to 30 or 40?

explanations.A: Almost, but is 289 closer to 280 or 290?
explanations.B: There are 31 days in March, which to the nearest ten is 30, and 289 to the nearest ten is 290, so 290 ÷ 30 will give a good estimate of the eggs per day.
explanations.C: Not quite - we want to round each number to the nearest 10 to get the closest possible estimate. There are 31 days in March, so what is the nearest ten to 31, and the nearest ten to 289?
explanations.D: Almost, but there are 31 days in March - is 31 closer to 30 or 40?

explanations.A: Almost, but it looks like you rounded 22 to 30 before you multiplied. Is 22 closer to 20 or 30?
explanations.B: 18 to the nearest ten is 20, and 22 to the nearest ten is 20, and 20 x 20 = 400 so 400 is a good estimate for his total earnings.
explanations.C: Not quite - we want to round each number to the nearest 10 to get the closest possible estimate. What is the nearest ten to 18, and the nearest ten to 22? Then multiply those rounded numbers together.
explanations.D: Almost, but it looks like you rounded 18 to 10 before you multiplied. Is 18 closer to 10 or 20?

explanations.A: 27 to the nearest ten is 30, and 33 to the nearest ten is 30, and 30 x 30 = 900 so 900 is a good estimate for his total earnings.
explanations.B: Almost, but it looks like you rounded 27 to 20 before you multiplied. Is 27 closer to 20 or 30?
explanations.C: Not quite - we want to round each number to the nearest 10 to get the closest possible estimate. What is the nearest ten to 27, and the nearest ten to 33? Then multiply those rounded numbers together.
explanations.D: Almost, but it looks like you rounded 33 to 40 before you multiplied. Is 33 closer to 30 or 40?
